DVSDriverException Class Reference

Error code returned from call to DVS driver API functions This exception is generated by routines in this class library when a function in the DVS driver API returns an error code (return value is not SV_OK) <. More...

Detailed Description

Error code returned from call to DVS driver API functions This exception is generated by routines in this class library when a function in the DVS driver API returns an error code (return value is not SV_OK) <.

p>You may use this exception class in your own code. See the example in the description of the public constructor below.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DVSDriverException::DVSDriverException (  int errcode,
const char * context,
std::exception * e
)  throw () [inline]
 

Standard constructor.

Parameters:
errcode   The error code returned from the DVS driver API function. You may choose to utilise this exception class in your own code, for example: 
   int return_value = sv_query(....)
   if (return_value != SV_OK)
     throw DVSDriverException(return_value, "call to sv_query(...)", NULL);
context   Information on the context in which this exception is occurring - eg. the function call that caused it. NULL if no context string is required
e   The causal parent exception of this one being instantiated. See DVSException::DVSException()
